SqlRetryLogicBase.summary: Retrieves the next time interval with respect to the number of retries if a transient condition occurs.

TransientPredicate.summary: Delegate to a transient condition predicate. The function that this delegate points to must return a true value when an expected transient exception happens.
TransientPredicate.value: value that delegates to a function that receives a input parameter.

RetryCondition.summary: Pre-retry validation for the sender state.
RetryCondition.returns: Returns if the sender is authorized to retry the operation.

remarks.format:
> [!IMPORTANT] > Operations that are part of a **Transaction** are not safe to retry without specific knowledge of business logic. Due to this complexity, retry logic should be managed at the application level.
> [!NOTE] > The `RetryCondition` is an extra condition that checks before executing the `TransientPredicate` and the default condition always returns **true**.
